channel.title: Need help with tree(object) spawning(with timer)
channel.description:
I get an award, I figured it out myself. Now, can someone teach me how to make a global object spawn on a timer?
Am I not being clear enough?

item.title: Need help with tree(object) spawning(with timer)
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

Fit yours to match my wc case:

case 1278: if(playerHasItem(1351) || (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1351)) { setAnimation(875); addItem(1511, 1); addSkillXP(1000, 8); sendMessage("You get some logs."); actionTimer = 100; actionTimer =- playerLevel[8]; ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 1342, -1, 10); } else { sendMessage("You need an axe to cut this tree!"); sendMessage("Try ::axeplz"); ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 1278, -1, 10); } break;
Yeah…I kinda have cases like that for about 6 trees…Don’t wanna alter them all.

item.title: Need help with tree(object) spawning(with timer)
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

[code]public void replaceTree(int objectX, int objectY, objectID) {
if (treetimer == 5) {
ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 1342);
treetimer = 0; }

if (treetimer == 0) {
ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 1278;
treetimer += 1;
}
}[/code]
Illegal start…wtf?

item.title: Need help with tree(object) spawning(with timer)
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

No wait.
I havn’t tried it out yet, but my brain’s clicking. If I have the timer set for 5 it removes the tree and adds the stump, and sets the timer to 0, how would I make time itself make the timer go to 1, so the tree comes back. Pointless if it’s at 5, the tree stump shows, and then it goes to 0, and in 0, it’s the tree again.

item.title: Need help with tree(object) spawning(with timer)
item.dc:creator: @Not_Pwnd Not Pwnd
item.description:
@Not_Pwnd wrote:

Sounds right ^. Make a void w/ a timer inplemented in it though.

I dont know java, but i’ll try

public void Imstupid(int dumbtimer, objectX, objectY, FaceID) {
then Idk if inside the void you declare

if (dumbtimer == 1) {
addGlobalObject();
dumbtimer == 0
}
if (dumbtimer == 2) {
addGlobalObject();
dumbtimer == 0
}
if player uses ID## with ID##
dumbtimer == 1
boom it spawns object.

K w/e im not that brilliant at java but I understand what im saying

item.title: Need help with tree(object) spawning(with timer)
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

ok, so say you want it to remove the tree after cutting it?

case ####: //tree (not been cut) ID
if (continueCutting == true) {
setAnimation(###); //woodcutting animation
if (misc.random(playerLevel[#]) != 0) { // woodcutting skill ID
addItem(####, 1); //log ID
ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, ID, 1, 10); //stumpy thing 
treeTimer = 10;
continueCutting = false;
} else {
if (misc.random(playerLevel[#]) == 0) { //woodcutting skill ID
continueCutting = true;
}
}
}

then declare

public boolean continueCuttong = false;
public int treeTimer = 0;

then where it says

if (actionTimer > 0) {
actionTimer -= 1;
}

add

if (treeTimer > 0) {
treeTimer -= 1;
}

then add this in boolean process

if (treeTimer <= 0) {
ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, ID, 1, 10); //actual tree, not stumpy thing
}

its flawed, not saying it isn’t, just made this off the top of my head.

Read full topic
